intro: Tridesmis pruniflora, commonly known as the cherry-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are a source of food for birds and other animals. It is found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid forest environments. Its parasitic nature allows it to derive water and nutrients from its host, while still performing photosynthesis to some extent.
